feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 10:24PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. Wind gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 2000 feet. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Wednesday.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 10:04PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area in the southern Inner Channels, Ketchikan near Ward Lake. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 08 at 8:59PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 70 below occuring. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range Passes.

entry.title: Avalanche Warning issued February 08 at 4:24PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Valdez Avalanche Center. ...THE VALDEZ AVALANCHE CENTER HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHATAvalanche warning. The avalanche danger is high. Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. * WHEREFor the mountains in and around Valdez and Thompson Pass

entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 65 below occuring, and blowing snow with reduced visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Near Passes of the Southeastern Brooks Range.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills to 40 below zero occurring, with blowing snow to one half mile or less at times. Plan on difficult travel conditions. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits and near Indian Mountain.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero are occurring. Blowing snow will cause reduced visibilities to one half mile or less along highway summits. Plan on difficult travel conditions.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. * WHERE...Elliott Highway Summits.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches are expected. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 12:46AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK SPOTS POSSIBLE INTO THE MORNING COMMUTE... Temperatures are expected to fall into the mid 20s to around 30 through the remainder of the overnight. Any wet pavement due to recent rain or melted snow on sidewalks or roadways may re-freeze into black ice as temperatures continue to fall. Secondary and side roads as well as shaded areas are most vulnerable to black

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued February 08 at 3:30PM HST until February 09 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A west northwest swell that will be arriving later today and through the overnight hours will elevate surf to advisory heights along northern and western exposed shores of the smaller islands. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY...
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala

entry.title: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 08 at 10:49AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: .DISCUSSION... Issued at 431 AM CST Tue Feb 8 2022 Very high to extreme fire weather conditions will overspread areas along and west of I-29 later this morning into the afternoon hours, with relative humidity values dropping down into the mid 20s to lower 30s. While these RH values are borderline for normal

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 12:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: West to southwest winds will occasionally gust between 50 and 55 mph over the South Laramie Range and North Snowy Range Foothills overnight. This includes Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins, and the Interstate 80 Summit. Drivers of high profile vehicles along these stretches of Interstate 80 should use extra caution.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range
